description:
Aliiroseovarius conchicola is a species of bacteria that belongs to the phylum Proteobacteria and the class Alphaproteobacteria. It was isolated from the inner surface of a marine bivalve mollusk shell (conchicola meaning "shell-dwelling").

Aliiroseovarius conchicola is a Gram-negative, aerobic, and non-spore-forming bacterium. It is characterized by its pink-pigmented colonies, which is due to the production of carotenoid pigments. The cells are typically rod-shaped and motile, with the ability to swim using flagella.

Phylogenetically, Aliiroseovarius conchicola is closely related to other members of the genus Aliiroseovarius, which are typically found in marine and coastal environments. The genus Aliiroseovarius is part of the family Rhodobacteraceae, known for their diverse metabolic capabilities and roles in various biogeochemical cycles.

Further studies on Aliiroseovarius conchicola could provide insights into its ecological function within the mollusk shell microbiome, its adaptations to the shell environment, and its potential biotechnological applications.
